metadata.title: CVE-2023-34256 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
** DISPUTED ** An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 6.3.3.There is an out-of-bounds read in crc16 in lib/crc16.c when called fromfs/ext4/super.c because ext4_group_desc_csum does not properly check anoffset. NOTE: this is disputed by third parties because the kernel is notintended to defend against attackers with the stated "When modifying theblock device while it is mounted by the filesystem" access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-34256` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-223-generic - 4.15.0-223.235
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-223-generic - 4.15.0-223.235
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-223-lowlatency - 4.15.0-223.235
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1150-kvm - 4.15.0-1150.155
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1166-aws - 4.15.0-1166.179
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1175-azure - 4.15.0-1175.190
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1160-gcp - 4.15.0-1160.177
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1129-oracle - 4.15.0-1129.140
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-223.235').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4, was needs-triage').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '5.4.0-162.179~18.04.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1150.155').
